fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • A list of English councils that had pledged to provide help for children on free school meals during half-term mistakenly showed Herefordshire council as Conservative-controlled. The council went to no overall control in 2019 and is run by a coalition of independents, the It’s Our County party and the Green party (Comfort food, 26 October, page 5). • A cryptic crossword clue, “Nine is the most popular time for broadcasters”, called for the answer PRIME. That clue should have started with 11, as nine is not a prime number (No 28,280, 2 November, page 8, Journal). • Other recently amended articles include: Ukip’s Nigel Farage finishes behind Bercow and independent Covid: keeping England’s schools open ‘will lead to another lockdown’ What you can and can’t do in England’s new Covid lockdown Businessman to hand over £10m following ‘unexplained wealth order’ ‘I hope it makes a difference’: voters on remote Maine island cast their ballots Protecting nature is vital to escape ‘era of pandemics’ – report From ice swims to knitting: Europeans seek ways to ride out Covid winter • The second correction was amended on 4 November 2020 because the crossword was in the paper on 2 November, not 2 October as an earlier version said.
